channel.title: BUbuisnessAndMarket
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbuisnessAndMarket, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: What it takes to be wealthy in America: $2.3 million, Charles Schwab says
item.description: Survey respondents said it feels like it takes more money to feel wealthy today compared to last year.

item.title: Exclusive: Crypto startup LI.FI raises $29 million for cross-blockchain price discovery tool
item.description: The company aims to make moving across blockchains more efficient.

item.title: A San Francisco woman just gave birth in a Waymo robotaxi—and Waymo says it’s not the first time that’s happened
item.description: “We’re proud to be a trusted ride for moments big and small, serving riders from just seconds old to many years young,” Waymo said.

item.title: Trump slams Fed’s third-straight rate cut as ‘too small,’ saying he wishes it was twice as large
item.description: Three Fed officials dissented from the move, the most dissents in six years and a sign of deep divisions on the committee.

item.title: Netflix’s takeover of Warner Brothers is a nightmare for consumers
item.description: Netflix promotes itself as an innovator, but its skyhigh bid for Warner Brothers suggests that its trendsetter days have peaked.

item.title: First-time unemployment claims surging after Thanksgiving
Economic calendar: Unemployment and trade data on docket following Fed rate cut
Nintendo's stock hit by rising memory chip prices
S&P and Nasdaq under tech-sector pressure as Dow negotiates gain after Fed cut
Eli Lilly obesity drug results in weight loss — and reduced knee pain — in trial
